quoteFirst: On the day of the new moon, a particular observation was made upon the tide in Malay Road; and it was high water at
quoteLast: in the morning, or nearly _eight hours and a quarter after_ the moon had passed the lower meridian; and the rise was ten feet two inches. There were two tides in the day; but from the swinging of the ship in the road, it appeared that the last of the ebb, as well as the whole of the flood, came from the N. E.

quoteFirst: The official dinners are always well done in Paris. I suppose the traditions of the Empire have been handed down. We arrived a few minutes before eight, all the staff and directors already there, and by
quoteLast: every one had arrived. I sat between Gérôme, the painter, and Renan, two very different men but each quite charming,--Gérôme tall, slight, animated, talking very easily about everything. He told me who a great many of the people were, with a little commentary on their profession and career which was very useful to me, as I knew so few of them.
